metadata.dc:author: Coello Casariego, G
Monge Jodrá, R
Alvarez-Vicent, J J
Rivas, E
Crespo del Hierro, J
Gete García, P
metadata.dc:description: Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibromas are vascular neoplasms, which originate characteristically in the posterior lateral wall of the nasopharynx. Although angiofibromas extend beyond the nasopharynx commonly, sometimes they can have their origin outside nasopharynx. We present an unusual case of extranasopharyngeal angiofibroma. A high level of suspicion is essential for an adequate diagnosis and treatment of these neoplasms.
metadata.dc:title: Angiofibroma extranasofaríngeo: aportación de un nuevo caso y revisión bibliográfica.
[Extra-naso-pharyngeal angiofibroma: report of a new case and review of literature].
